definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: The effect of real-time water surface can consumedly enhance the immersion characteristic of virtual reality system.
sentences.chinese: 實時水面效果可以大大增強虛擬現實系統的沉浸感。

sentences.english: With open shop for inheritance award-winning uncomplicated, full-time immersed collection.
sentences.chinese: 以開網店爲業的林強遊手好閒，全日沉浸收集。

sentences.english: By the time afternoon rolls around, you’re in caffeine withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 下午時光流逝，你沉浸在咖啡因裏面。

sentences.english: The whole city was immersed in a festival atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 全城沉浸在節日氣氛之中。

sentences.english: B: People are still bathing in the afterglow of its selection as the 2008 Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 人們仍然沉浸在成功申辦2008年奧運會的喜悅中。

sentences.english: Pessimists give us license to indulge our most misanthropic thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 悲觀主義者給了我們沉浸於厭惡人類的思想中的許可。

sentences.english: We became totally immersed in our work.
sentences.chinese: 我們完全沉浸在我們的工作中。

sentences.english: But you have to submerge yourself in those groups, and I don't speak it enough,
sentences.chinese: 但你必須把自己沉浸於這些小組裏，我說得不夠多。

sentences.english: Hadid herself created the immersive display for her objects.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪德爲了她的物品創造了沉浸式虛擬現實顯示。

sentences.english: Try not to wallow in feelings of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓自己沉浸在愧疚的深淵裏。

sentences.english: Remember; take the time you need to really immerse yourself in the emotion.
sentences.chinese: 記住，你要花必要的時間去真正沉浸於那種情緒之中。

sentences.english: For the next two days Carrie indulged in the most high-flown speculations .
sentences.chinese: 接下來的兩天，嘉莉沉浸在想入非非中。

sentences.english: The vale was wrapped in a dim atmosphere of unnaturalness.
sentences.chinese: 峽谷沉浸在一種不自然的朦朧氣氛裏。

sentences.english: I was playing a so beautiful rondo that even when it accomplished I was still immersed in it.
sentences.chinese: 那是一首優美的迴旋曲，曲終我仍沉浸其中。

sentences.english: I tend to dwell more on the negative and my worries.
sentences.chinese: 我傾向於沉浸在被動否定的情緒和自己的麻煩事中。

sentences.english: They were too much absorbed in their mutual joy to suffer embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 他們過於沉浸在相互歡樂裏，一點兒不覺得窘。

definition: to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
China Times (newspaper)/abbr. for 中國時報|中国时报 [Zhong1 guo2 Shi2 bao4]
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
to free oneself/to extricate oneself from a difficult situation
